amendment.description: Amendment sought to make open to the public all records in product liability cases, except under special circumstances.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to prohibit sealing court records of product liability law suits, except under limited circumstances. The amendment would allow court records to be sealed only by a court order and only if the information to be sealed would not restrict information relevant to public health or safety; or if the need to maintain confidentiality would substantially outweigh the public interest in disclosing potential health or safety hazards.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Schumer amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 184 - 243 (Roll no. 220).
